00295 #include "CEvent.h"                             
00296 #include <CEventMonitor.h>

00303 // Static data:
00304 
00305 static const string RegistryName = "Events";
00306 static const unsigned long StartupDelayuSec = 100000; // 0.1s thread startup delay.
00307 // Local class to start event threads (used by schedule).
00308 
00309 class StartEventThread : public DAQThread
00310 {
00311 protected:
00312   virtual int operator()(int nargs, char** ppArgs)
00313   {
00314     Detach();
00315     char* argv[1] = { (char*)this };
00316     CEvent* pThread = (CEvent*)ppArgs[0]; // Convert param to event.
00317     usleep(StartupDelayuSec);
00318     daq_dispatcher.Dispatch(*pThread, 1, argv);
00319     usleep(StartupDelayuSec);   // Give the startup thread time to join.
00320     return 0;
00321   }
00322 };

00431 CEvent::~CEvent()
00432 {
00433   Disable();                    // Shutdown thread.
00434 }
00435 // Major class functions:
00436 
00448 void
00449 CEvent::Enable()
00450 {
00451   CApplicationSerializer::getInstance()->Lock(); // <-- Critical region
00452   {
00453     if(!m_fEnabled) {
00454       m_fEnabled = true;        // Active is set by event thread.
00455       m_Tid      = daq_dispatcher.Dispatch(*this);
00456     }
00457   }
00458   CApplicationSerializer::getInstance()->UnLock(); // <-- End Critical region.
00459 }
00478 void
00479 CEvent::Disable()
00480 {
00481 
00482   DAQThreadId id = m_Tid;       // Snapshot the tid, in case restarted.
00483   m_fEnabled     = false;       // Schedule the thread stop.
00484 
00485   if(m_fActive) {
00486     bool fHeldMutex(false);
00487     int  nLockLevel;
00488     CApplicationSerializer& mutex(*(CApplicationSerializer::getInstance()));
00489     DAQStatus stat;
00490     if( daqthread_self() == mutex.getOwningThread()) { // If we own the mutex
00491       fHeldMutex = true;                      // Save the context and unlock 
00492       nLockLevel = mutex.getLockLevel();      // at whatever required depth.
00493       mutex.UnLockCompletely();
00494     }
00495     Join(id, &stat);            // Wait for the thread to stop running.
00496     if(fHeldMutex) {            // If we previously had the mutex, relock at
00497       for(int i=0; i < nLockLevel; i++) { // the previous locking depth:
00498         mutex.Lock();
00499       }
00500     }
00501   }
00502 }
00511 void 
00512 CEvent::setReactivity(int nMs)
00513 {
00514   m_nMsReactivity = nMs;
00515 }
00525 void
00526 CEvent::ReactToTimeouts(bool fReact)
00527 {
00528   m_InformTimeouts = fReact;
00529 }
00533 string
00534 CEvent::DescribeSelf()
00535 {
00536   string result("Event processor: ");
00537   result += CNamedObject::DescribeSelf();
00538   result += "\n";
00539   result += "  My Event Monitor is: \n";
00540   result += m_rMonitor.DescribeSelf();
00541   result += "\n  My Event Reactor is: \n";
00542   result += m_rReactor.DescribeSelf();
00543 
00544   result += " State:\n          ";
00545   result += (m_fEnabled ? "Enabled " : "Disabled ");
00546   result += (m_fActive  ? "Active "  : "Inactive ");
00547   if(m_nMsReactivity < 0) {
00548     result += " Timeouts are disabled\n";
00549   } else {
00550     result += " Timeouts are enabled\n";
00551   }
00552   return result;
00553 }
00564 void
00565 CEvent::OnEvent(CEventMonitor::result why)
00566 {
00567   ProcessQueues();              // Process any thread IPC's.
00568   if((why == CEventMonitor::TimedOut) && !m_InformTimeouts) 
00569     return;
00570   CApplicationSerializer::getInstance()->Lock(); // <-- Critical region
00571   {
00572     m_rReactor(m_rMonitor, why);
00573   }
00574   CApplicationSerializer::getInstance()->UnLock(); // <-- End Critical region.
00575  
00576 }
00594 void
00595 CEvent::Schedule()
00596 {
00597   char* argv[1] = {(char*)this};
00598 
00599   m_fEnabled = true;
00600   StartEventThread* pStartup = new StartEventThread;
00601   daq_dispatcher.Dispatch(*pStartup, 1, argv);
00602 }
00615 int
00616 CEvent::operator()(int nargs, char** ppArgs)
00617 {
00618   m_Tid = (DAQThreadId&)GetId();
00619   m_fActive = true;
00620 
00621 
00622   // Execute the main event loop:
00623 
00624   m_rMonitor.setTimeout(m_nMsReactivity);
00625   while(m_fEnabled){
00626     OnEvent(m_rMonitor());
00627   }
00628   // When m_fEnabled goes false, someone wants us dead...
00629 
00630   m_fActive = false;
00631   return 0;
00632 }
00637 DAQStatus
00638 CEvent::JoinThis()
00639 {
00640   DAQStatus Status;
00641   Join(m_Tid, &Status);
00642   return Status;
00643 }
00649 void
00650 CEvent::ProcessQueues()
00651 {
00652 }
